conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the pedestrian and the bus using the velocity-time graph.
The pedestrian's speed is 8 m/s from the graph.
The distance covered by the pedestrian as a function of time is d_ped = 8t.
The bus starts from rest and accelerates uniformly; the slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration.
The acceleration of the bus is 1 m/s².
The distance covered by the bus as a function of time is d_bus = 0.5t².
Find the time when the pedestrian catches up with the bus: 8t = 0.5t² + 36.
Rearrange to form a quadratic equation: 0.5t² - 8t + 36 = 0.
Solve using the quadratic formula: t = (16 ± √(-32))/2.
The discriminant is negative, so there are no real solutions for t.
The pedestrian cannot catch up with the bus.
